title: For Sale:  LaRue Tactical 5.56 Stealth Sniper System
postcontent:
Like new (documented 256 rounds) LaRue Stealth.  Upper is 16" barrel with 13.2" hand guard and Surefire MB556K Suppressor (installed by LaRue during build). 

Lower is a LaRue billet lower (LaRue no longer sells these independently) with a DPMS LPK (what LaRue uses).  Fire/Safety selector was upgrade to the BAD-ASS selector.  The trigger was also upgraded to a Geissele S3G.  The pistol grip is a Magpul MOE grip and the stock is a LMT SOPMOD.  The pistol grip and SOPMOD are FDE in color.  

If interested other accessories (i.e. Leupold MK IV MR/T in a Larue mount, Larue index clips, LaRue Sights, etc.) can be purchased in ADDITION to the listed price for the rifle.  Serious inquiries can request pictures of the rifle and test target and all correspondence with be done through email.  Test target is a 5-round group of 69grn. SMK's shot in late June from 100 yards. Group is (well) under .50 MOA.

I will provide two (2) NIW FDE or Black 30 round MAGPUL PMAGS to the buyer.

Price is $4,000.  Outside the Cincinnati area, shipping to a FFL will apply.

title: Want To Buy:  350.00
For Sale:  Savage 99C .308
postcontent: Manufactured early 1980's, this was my first rifle. I hunt with pistol now and need room in my gun safe. I had the habit of removing the rear stock every year after hunting season to thoroughly clean and oil internals. Rear stock was cut down slightly and new pad mounted to give it a 12.5" pull. I've had a comment the front stock is not factory. The rifle is exactly the same as I received it when I was 14. I recall my dad ordering it new and having a pad installed, but I have no memory of anyone changing the front end. Comes with mounted scope base and two clips. I have ammo also.

title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer p250 Sub Compact .45 acp Exchange Kit w/ Night Sights

postcontent:
I'm selling a gently used Sig Sauer p250 Sub Compact .45 acp Exchange Kit with night sights.  It functions perfectly and is in overall good cosmetic condition.  The slide is in near perfect shape.  The frame has a small nick by the takedown hole, but is almost un-noticeable when the takedown lever is inserted.  The night sights are very bright.  The kit comes with complete slide, polymer frame, one 6 round magazine, and padded cary case. This kit new retails for $289.  Please message for any questions or pictures.  For pics - Here is the link on eBay: 

http://www.ebay.com/itm/Sig-Sauer-p250-Sub-Compact-45-acp-Exchange-Kit-w-Night-Sights-/REDACTED25?_trksid=p5197.m1992&_trkparms=aid%3D111000%26algo%3DREC.CURRENT%26ao%3D1%26asc%3D13835%26meid%3DREDACTED187849252%26pid%3D100015%26prg%3D1085%26rk%3D1%26sd%3DREDACTED25%26

For those not familiar with this product - This is not a complete firearm.  It does not have the serialized Fire Control Unit, and WILL NOT operate with out it. You must already own a Sig Sauer p250 firearm in order for this kit to be of any use.  For reasons above, the purchase of this product does not require an FFL transfer and can be shipped directly to you.  Will ship: buyer pays actual shipping cost.  Preferred payment is PayPal, but I'll take a check and send once the check has cleared. Message me with any questions.  SERIOUS inquiries only.

The KSG (Kel-Tec Shotgun) is Kel-Tec CNC’s first entry into the shotgun market. The size, shape, and design is similar to the currently available Kel-Tec RFB rifle, but the KSG ejects downward, instead of forward. The KSG weighs 6.9 lbs. and is as compact as legally possible with a 26.1” overall length and an 18.5” cylinder bore barrel. Even with this compact size, the internal dual tube magazines hold an impressive 12 rounds of 12 gauge 3” rounds in total (6 per tube).      Handguard

title: For Sale/Trade:  VZ 58 VZ58 VZ2008 (similar to ak47) brand new never fired
location: East side of Columbus, Columbus, Ohio
postcontent:
I purchased this Century International arms VZ2008 less than a month ago and decided it does not fit into my collection so up for sale it goes. First and foremost I am NOT looking to capitalize on the upswing in the market, I have receipts for $799.99 plus $35 shipping plus $20 FFL transfer I am in this thing for over $850. I myself have flagged my firearms on this site for being outrageous, I am only looking to recoup my investment and get something different.  I encourage you to check J&G sales website the current price is $899.99 (plus shipping FFL transfer it will be right at $1,000. Again you will see I am not gauging or inflating my price. 

I purchased this from J & G sales the current price is $899.  I encourage you to check it out. Please note I have not doubled the price of this item like others are doing right now. This "assault style" rifle with its 30 round magazines will certainly be on the bye bye list, we all know that. 

The VZ 58 platform is what many consider to be an improved version of the AK, it has a fully milled receiver, bolt hold open, larger ejection port, aluminum 30 round magazines (I am including 2) and an overall improved fit and finish, resulting in improved ergonomics, reduced weight and superior accuracy.  I suggest you check out youtube and read about these VZ 58s if you aren't familiar with them and these are revealed as some of Century Arms best builds.  This gun has never been fired or loaded. I disassembled, fully cleaned and lubricated the gun and put it in my climate controlled safe.  

What you see is what you get, the VZ2008, 2 30rnd mags one is black and one is grey and original paperwork.  All numbers are matching, and this firearm as stated is in new condition with zero defects or blemishes. The synthetic furniture is all matching and in good shape.  If 

I have a few items I will consider as trades: smith governor, M1 carbine, AR 15, AK47 (other than wasr), 223 ammo, K98, Kimber 1911. While this is not an exhaustive list, please understand I am a "fine" gun collector and I do not deal in junk or rusty firearms.  I am not willing to travel greater than 45 minutes.  I am a reasonable guy and all trades up or down will be based upon fair values of items.  Lt me know what ya have worst I can say is no.  

I will consider shipping this from my ffl to your ffl, but there will be shipping, packaging and my ffl dealers fees added to final cost.

title: For Sale:  EOTech XPS2-0 Holgraphic sight
postcontent:
Holographic Weapons site for sale, $525.00. Brand new in case and pacakgeing never used. Smaller and lighter than other holographic weapon sights, the EOTech XPS2-0 is an ideal compact option for your weapon platform. The XPS2-0 sports a revolutionary sighting system based on advanced holographic technology. The design works by using laser light to illuminate a holographic pattern embedded in the heads-up display window. When the shooter looks through the window, he or she will see a virtual red image of a reticle pattern projected onto the target plane. Overall, the holographic sight improves target acquisition, boosts accuracy, and increases control over the shooting environment.

Will be in Tucson on 30 Dec if you are interested!

title: For Sale:  Brand New Glock 23 Magazine  13 round capacity
location: Shiloh - near Scott Air Force base, St. Louis, Illinois
postcontent:
This is a brand new magazine - never been shot nor loaded.
These run $30 new - only $50 here.  These are going for much higher on Gunbroker.


Info . . . 

Product Information
Shop more Glock products This is a factory original, drop-free magazine for your Glock. Glock magazines have a hardened steel insert encased in high tech polymer. This polymer coating protects the magazine and prevents deformation, even when dropped from a great height.

Technical Informaion:

Glock magazines have very stiff springs when new and may be extremely difficult to load to full capacity. It may be necessary to use a Glock magazine loader (generally included in the Glock case with the handgun) to load the magazine to capacity or near capacity.

If the last round appears impossible to load, for example if the magazine should hold 13 rounds and it will only accept 12, leave it loaded with 12 rounds for several days to allow the spring's tension to decrease. After a short time, the magazine should then accept its full capacity, but it may still be necessary to use the magazine loader. After several cycles of full capacity through empty, the magazine will be easier to load.

title: For Sale:  Saiga 7.62x39mm rifle (converted), 5 mags, PA Micro red dot, 155rd of TulAmmo
postcontent:
I'm willing to negotiate the price if you're genuinely interested. I'm in no real rush to liquidate this rifle so I'll definitely consider offers as they come. The rifle will ship via UPS to a local FFL of your choice, shipping is included in the price. If you're in my state, a face-to-face might be possible, but we'd have to work out the feasibility and the terms.

The base rifle (16" barrel 7.62x39mm Saiga rifle) was purchased new in January 2012 and the conversion was completed that May. Rifle has around 500 rounds through it, so there's a bit of wear and tear on the operating parts but nothing out of the ordinary. If you want interior detail shots or alternate angles, feel free to ask.

I'll give the rifle a good through cleaning before shipment so it'll be all sparkly and whatnot when you receive it. The aftermarket parts are as follows:

-US-made KVAR polymer stock w/ cleaning kit trapdoor (stock Saiga cleaning kit naturally included)
-Ergo pistol grip
-Tapco G2 fire control group
-Bullet guide installed to allow feeding from traditional AK magazines
-Uninssued Bulgarian polymer handguard (US-made heat shield) mounted using US-made handguard retainer
-UltimAK railed gas tube for scout-style scopes and electronic sights
-Primary Arms Micro red dot (mounted on the UltimAK rail as pictured)

The five magazines are four Romanian 30rd mil-surp steel magazines in fair to good condition (just got them a few weeks ago and cleaned them up) as well as the stock Saiga 10rd magazine. While proprietary 30rd Saiga magazines (like those made by SGM/Surefire) have spotty reliability now that a bullet guide has been installed, the 10rd mag still feeds great and is useful for benchrest shooting.

In addition to everything listed above, the rifle also comes with a NcStar soft case with five mag pouches (I know, very fancy), a bare-bones Blackhawk! two-point sling, a UTG front sight tool, and the stock Saiga cleaning rod. I've also got 155 rounds of TulAmmo 7.62x39mm FMJ that I'll include as a freebie. Since the ammo has to ship separately (as per UPS guidelines regarding the shipment of firearms and ammunition), I'll load those rounds into the five magazines and some stripper clips and ship those straight to your door as opposed to shipping the empty magazines with the rifle parcel.

Private message me offers and questions, I'll do my best to respond.

title: For Sale:  TI (Tactical Innovations) Ruger 10/22-25 round magazine
postcontent:
Our TI25 MACHINED ALUMINUM 25 round Ruger 10/22 high capacity magazine is the undisputed PREMIUM Ruger 10/22 Magazine on the market. Customer after customer have continued to tell us how much they love the ability to adjust their TI25 mags to exactly fit their gun as well as the ability to take the mag apart to clean it. Quality costs money, but the features that are only found in this mag have already made our MACHINED ALUMINUM TI25 MAGS famous!  Read on and you'll see why TI25 mags are an easy choice for serious shooters!
  1. MACHINED AIRCRAFT ALUMINUM CONSTRUCTION FROM SOLID ALUMINUM BARS

	Our TI25 Machined Aluminum Magazine is the toughest, most durable Ruger 10/22 magazine on the market without exception. The 2 body halves are MACHINED one at a time out of solid T6 aircraft aluminum bar with the same precision and tolerances as space and defense and aircraft parts. We start off with 3 POUNDS OF SOLID AIRCRAFT ALUMINUM BAR and high speed CNC machine for over an hour to wind up with a complete mag body that now weighs only a little more than 8 ounces! Each part has to pass our exacting quality control examination to ensure its precise dimensions. The result is you wind up with an aircraft quality part that some would consider an "over kill" for a 10/22, while others of us consider it exactly what we've been looking for... Our TI25 Machined Aluminum magazines are designed to stand up to hard use. Don't settle for less!
  2. COMPLETELY DISASSEMBLE TO CLEAN OR SERVICE

	Anyone that's shot .22 rimfire ammo knows how dirty it is, and a lot of the crud gets into the inside of the magazine which continues to make the mag less reliable. Now with our TI25 mag, that problem no longer exists. Three stainless steel cap screws make it easy to disassemble the mag into two separate halves for cleaning using the supplied allen wrench. Scrub the INSIDE with some hot soapy water, dry and reassemble and its as clean as it when it was new. Yep, it costs us more to make a mag that you can disassemble rather then just gluing it permanently together, but being able to disassemble it is the right way to make a mag!
  3. PRECISION ADJUSTABLE TO EXACTLY FIT YOUR GUN

	Have you ever wondered (and cursed) about the amount of wiggle in all other 10/22 high capacity mags? A magazine should not wiggle that much in your gun, but it has to to fit... WELL NOT ANY MORE! It has been our experience that Ruger 10/22 rifles have some minor variations from one to the next which explains why one brand mag will run well in one gun and the same mag then not run in a different gun. What separates this mag from all others is the patent pending ability to micro adjust it for an exact fit in your gun for (1)FEED ANGLE, (2) FEED HEIGHT and (3) EJECTOR TO BOLT DISTANCE using the supplied 3/32" allen wrench. Four cap screws on the top of the mag that mate with your 10/22 receiver allow the mag to quickly be precision adjusted for an exact fit in your gun by minimally increasing or decreasing the individual heights of each of the cap screws (like leveling an appliance), resulting in a magazine that has minimal to no wiggle in your gun AND THAT WORKS!. The ability to quickly one time precision adjust it to your gun means that you can count on reliable feeding every time.

Specs and info:

One of our ALL TIME BEST Carbine models, the M4 Type features a distinctive Military Barrel Profile and Six Position Telestock – great for 3 Gun Match Shooting, Home Defense and Law Enforcement use.

The Bushmaster A2 & A3 Type Patrolman’s Carbines are modeled after our M4 Type Carbines, but with additional barrel length to make them legal for sale to individual officers (semi-automatic configuration with 16" barrel).

The 5.56mm/.223 Rem. caliber 16" barrel is chrome lined in both bore and chamber for long wear life and ease of maintenance. For control of muzzle flash and muzzle rise in rapid fire, a “birdcage” type suppressor is factory installed. A mil. spec. manganese phosphate outer coating insures protection against corrosion or rust on the barrel and all critical steel parts of the weapon.

Forged, lightweight 7075T6 aircraft quality aluminum receivers are designed for simplicity of maintenance and reliability of operation and they incorporate all M16A2 design improvements including cartridge case deflector, bolt catch assembly and raised ribs for protection against accidental magazine release. A six position telescoping buttstock offers light weight, carrying ease and quick handling.

The telestock, pistol grip and two piece handguards are all molded of strong black thermoset composite material. The handguards are internally shielded against barrel heat build-up. The dual aperture M16A2 rear sight system on these carbines offer both windage and elevation adjustment calibrated in meters.

The A3 Type Patrolman’s Carbine includes a Removable Carry Handle - adjustment range is from from 300 to 600 meters (1/2 M.o.A. elevation and 1/2 M.o.A. windage).

Once the Carry Handle is removed, a wide variety of scopes, red dot or holographic sights, or night vision equipment may be mounted on the Upper Receiver’s integral Picatinny rail. Iron sight zero is completely repeatable when the handle is reattached by means of its knurled knobs.

The Bushmaster A2/A3 Type Patrolman’s Carbines are shipped complete with 30 round magazine, safety and operational manual, and carry sling.
